title: roffelsaur
author: roffelsaur
content: Hey thereI'm recently reorganising my BTC and wanted to send some BTC from my Armory wallet. I was facing issues with this so decided to sweep the keys into a different wallet on Electrum. This worked, partially, and Armory now shows that I still have some BTC in my wallet. I checked the address on the blockchain explorer, which confirms that my BTC are still there. However, I can't seem to sweep this particular private key (Electrum says no input found), nor does the send BTC button work. I click it and nothing happens :/Just wondering what I can do here to get things going here? Any insight would be most appreciated

comments.author: goatpig
comments.body: You would have to post your log file. You can extract it from the Files menu.

comments.author: nc50lc
comments.body: Quote from: roffelsaur on May 09, 2023, 04:37:47 AMHowever, I can't seem to sweep this particular private key (Electrum says no input found),You may have to add the script type prefix in Electrum when sweeping your Bitcoins.Just click the tooltip button (Info) in 'Sweep private keys' window to know which prefix to use depending on your address' script type.But if your address is P2SH-P2PK, Electrum wont be able to sweep it.

comments.author: roffelsaur
comments.created_time: May 10, 2023, 07:18:55 AMLast edit: May 10, 2023, 08:18:16 AM by roffelsaur
comments.body: EDIT: Had to perform a Factory Reset/Uninstall/Reinstall a couple of times and finally got it working. Guess the 2021 install was messing things up >_<Thanks!
